intro: Themistoclesia pentandra, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a climbing plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its palmate leaves and distinctive yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically yellow or orange when ripe. It is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and shrublands. The botanical features of Themistoclesia pentandra make it an important species in both ecological and traditional medicinal contexts.
